com.googlecode.streamflyer.xml
Class InvalidXmlCharacterModifier

java.lang.Object
  com.googlecode.streamflyer.xml.InvalidXmlCharacterModifier
All Implemented Interfaces:
Modifier
public class InvalidXmlCharacterModifier
extends Object
implements Modifier

This modifier replaces invalid XML characters in an stream that contains an XML document.

Contents

1. How do I use this modifier?
2. In addition to the replacement of the invalid characters I want to record the replacements and sent notifications. How can I do this?
3. How can I find out the position of the matches within the stream?
4. How do I use this class with an InputStream?
5. How much memory does the modifier consume?
6. When should I not use this modifier?

1. How do I use this modifier?

EXAMPLE 1. This example shows how to remove the invalid characters: 

// choose the character stream to modify
Reader reader = new StringReader("foo?bar");

// define what and how to replace (the empty string as replacement)
Modifier modifier = new InvalidXmlCharacterModifier("",
        InvalidXmlCharacterModifier.XML_11_VERSION);

// create the modifying reader that wraps the original reader
ModifyingReader modifyingReader = new ModifyingReader(reader, modifier);

// use the modifying reader instead of the original reader
String actualOutput = IOUtils.toString(modifyingReader);

assertEquals("foobar", actualOutput);

EXAMPLE 2. This example shows how to replace the invalid characters with an error message: 

// choose the character stream to modify
Reader reader = new StringReader("foo?bar");

// define what and how to replace (an error message as replacement)
Modifier modifier = new InvalidXmlCharacterModifier(
        "[INVALID XML CHAR FOUND: $0]",
        InvalidXmlCharacterModifier.XML_11_VERSION);

// create the modifying reader that wraps the original reader
ModifyingReader modifyingReader = new ModifyingReader(reader, modifier);

// use the modifying reader instead of the original reader
String actualOutput = IOUtils.toString(modifyingReader);

assertEquals("foo[INVALID XML CHAR FOUND: U+D8FF]bar", actualOutput);

2. In addition to the replacement of the invalid characters I want to record the replacements and sent notifications. How can I do this?

Subclass InvalidXmlCharacterModifier and override replacement(StringBuilder).

3. How can I find out the position of the invalid characters within the stream?


You must count the characters that you skip. You can do this by subclassing InvalidXmlCharacterModifier and overwrite Modifier.modify(StringBuilder, int, boolean).

You might find LineColumnAwareModificationFactory and PositionAwareModificationFactory helpful as well.

4. How do I use this class with an InputStream?

See ModifyingReaderFactory#createInvalidXmlCharacterRemovingModifier(java.io.InputStream).

5. How much memory does the modifier consume?

The memory consumption of this modifier is roughly given by the first argument of InvalidXmlCharacterModifier(int, String, String, boolean).

6. When should I not use this modifier?

Use XmlVersionModifier instead of this class if only the (wrong) version in the prolog of the XML document restricts the range of valid characters.

Since:
23.06.2011
Author:
rwoo

modify

public AfterModification modify(StringBuilder characterBuffer,
                                int firstModifiableCharacterInBuffer,
                                boolean endOfStreamHit)
Description copied from interface: Modifier
Processes the characters in the given character buffer, i.e. deletes or replaces or inserts characters, or keeps the characters as they are.

Specified by:
modify in interface Modifier
Parameters:
characterBuffer - The next characters provided from the modifiable stream. It contains the modifiable characters, (optionally) preceded by unmodifiable characters.

The modifier can modify the content of the buffer as appropriate the modifier must not modify the unmodifiable characters, i.e. the characters before position firstModifiableCharacterInBufferIndex must not be modified.

Your modifier should manage the capacity of the buffer on its own - as the optimal management of the capacity depends on the specific purpose of the modifier.

The given buffer must be never null.

firstModifiableCharacterInBuffer - index of the first modifiable character in the buffer. The index of the first character in the buffer is zero. If there is not modifiable character in the buffer, then this value is equal the length of the buffer.
endOfStreamHit - True if no more characters can be read from the stream, i.e. the character buffer contains the all the characters up to the end of the stream.
Returns:
Returns an object that defines how ModifyingReader or ModifyingWriter shall behave before calling Modifier.modify(StringBuilder, int, boolean) again.
See Also:
Modifier.modify(java.lang.StringBuilder, int, boolean)

onMatch

protected int onMatch(StringBuilder characterBuffer)
Replaces the found invalid XML character with the given replacement.

You may override this method to insert some information about invalid character in to the character buffer.
